title: Fact Check: Picture of Delhi’s Akshardham temple shared as proposed design of Ayodhya’s Ram temple | Newsmobile
author: newsmobile.in
vclaim:
Ahead of the foundation stone laying ceremony of the Ram temple in Ayodhya, a picture is being shared on social media with claims that state that it is the proposed design of the temple to be built in Ayodhya, Uttar Pradesh.

More such post can be seen here, here and here.

NewsMobile fact-checked the above post and found the claim to be false.

We put the image through Reverse Image Search and found the same picture on Reddit. The picture was captioned, “Swaminarayan Akshardham Complex (Akshardham Temple) Noida Mor, Pandav Nagar, New Delhi, Delhi, India. ”

We then looked for some pictures of Akshardham temple on Google and found that they were similar to the picture in the above post.

When we compared one of the images posted on the official website of Akshardham temple to the post in question, we found that both the images have similar architectural design and floor patterns.

Even the satellite images available on Google Earth shows the same design and flooring.

Hence, from the above information, it is clear that the post in question is false.
